page.title: 08THE FENS AND FISHING.
page.content: The Fens is one of the most important coarse fishing areas in the country.Nowadays fishing is a very popular leisure activity.Anglers do not usually fish for food,they use sophisticated tackle and they do need a permit.However in the past poaching for fish ,especially eels, was a way of providing extra food and income.Rods and lines were rarely used.When the drains were pumped the water flow was reduced to a trickle and poachers would use a pilfer (a 5 or 7 pronged fork.)When eels were being sought a glaive (an implement similar to a pilfer)was employed.Big fish such as the pike were caught in nets.
